[GRAMMAR]: Subject-verb agreement errors (e.g., "all doors was open," "it take")
Incorrect pronoun usage ("as I is an American")

[TRANSITION]: Abrupt shift from discussing bourgeoisie to war zone logistics
[STRUCTURE]: Repetitive listing of locations without clear contextual framing
[CLARITY]: Assumed knowledge of geographical significance (e.g., Bar-le-Duc, Verdun)

[LEXICON]: Slightly formal tone shifts (e.g., "I sniffed and grumbled")

[STRUCTURE]: Abrupt transition from battlefield description to bureaucratic interactions
[TRANSITION]: Weak link between village war experience and train station observations
